cause.description:
One of the major point we want to pass on to our community is that bone marrow is RARELY USED once a donor is matched to a patient. Blood STEM CELLS are collected [just like platelets are collection at the blood bank and the blood is returned to you] and transfered to the patient.
Because of the unique genetic make up of Armenians, it is nearly impossible to find suitable matches among the existing international registries. When you become a donor through Match For Life, you are participating in an effort to give patients with leukemia and other life-threatening blood diseases a second chance at life.
1. Be a donor! Save a life!
